benchmark_details.name: CoSafe
benchmark_details.overview: CoSafe is a dataset comprising 1,400 multi-turn dialogue coreference questions across 14 categories, designed to evaluate the safety of large language models (LLMs) in dialogue coreference contexts.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate and enhance the safety of large language models in multi-turn dialogue scenarios by identifying vulnerabilities related to coreference.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: Semantic drift in multi-turn questions; high cost of generating multi-turn dialogue coreferences.

data.source: Dataset created using prompts derived from BeaverTails (Ji et al. 2023) and expanded using GPT-4.
data.annotation: Automated expansion of prompts into multi-turn dialogues using GPT-4 with manual refinement.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated through comparisons between responses generated for single prompts and multi-turn dialogues.
methodology.interpretation: Higher attack successful rates indicate increased vulnerabilities in dialogue coreference scenarios.
methodology.validation: Validation was conducted using multiple evaluation methods and cross-comparisons of harmful rates.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Analysis of model responses indicated varying harmfulness across demographic categories.
harm: Potential to generate harmful or unsafe responses due to coreference manipulation.
